snippet: In a charged and clenched debate, President Obama portrayed Mitt Romney as a former corporate raider, while Mr. Romney kept bringing the discussion back to Mr. Obama’s record.
abstract: Second debate between Pres Obama and Mitt Romney is one of the most intensive in the history of televised debating, with tensions spilling over into interruptions, personal rebukes and accusations of lying; Pres Obama strikes a formidable and assertive posture that is in stark contrast to his lackluster performance at the first debate.

byline.original: By JIM RUTENBERG and JEFF ZELENY

lead_paragraph: In a charged and clenched debate, President Obama portrayed Mitt Romney as a former corporate raider, while Mr. Romney kept bringing the discussion back to Mr. Obama’s record.

headline.seo: Obama and Romney Turn Up the Temperature at Their Second Debate
headline.main: Rivals Bring Bare Fists to Rematch
headline.print_headline: Obama and Romney Mount Biting Attacks in Debate Rematch
headline.sub: Biting Tone Shapes 2nd Debate for Obama and Romney
